alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 3:55PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elmore, west central Macon and northeastern Montgomery Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 355 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ten Cedar Estates to Blue Ridge to Waugh. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. Gusty winds may occur well ahead of the storms. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eastern Montgomery, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Milstead, Pike Road, Elmore, Coosada, Deatsville, Eclectic, Shorter, Montgomery Zoo, Boylston, Santuck, Auburn University In Montgomery, Bob Woodruff Lake, Emerald Mountain, Ten Cedar Estates, Waugh and Dexter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
